definition: to step on/to tread/to stamp/to press a pedal/to pedal (a bike)/(online) to downvote
to tread/to stamp/to step on/to press a pedal/to investigate on the spot

sentences.english: A running track should be capable of absorbing the impact of a runner's foot landing on it.
sentences.chinese: 跑道應該能夠吸收奔跑者踩踏地面時產生的撞擊力。

sentences.english: The other arose out of the habitual activity of the park’s users.
sentences.chinese: 另一組是由逛公園的人們的習慣性活動踩踏出來的。

sentences.english: Firstly, when using the staircases, do not run or push others and always walk on the right side.
sentences.chinese: 上下樓梯時不推不擠，要靠右行，避免發生踩踏事故。

sentences.english: To stop, riders must pedal in reverse, which diffentiates from road bikes.
sentences.chinese: 與公路賽不同，死飛在剎車時需要人反向踩踏板。

sentences.english: This Lion will trample the Boar under foot and terrify it with its open maw.
sentences.chinese: 獅子會用足底踩踏野豬，用張開的胃恐嚇它。

sentences.english: Goes to the barbarous clangour of a gong.
sentences.chinese: 踩踏着一面銅鑼的野蠻的鏗鏘節拍。

sentences.english: Because Lucy has long legs she pedals.
Having warned the tourists not to tread on the troughs, Tan continued with his work.
sentences.chinese: 提醒遊人不要踩踏鹽槽後，譚孟福繼續低頭修補鹽槽。

sentences.english: Stepping on wet cement is a big no-no.
sentences.chinese: 踩踏尚未全乾的水泥地是非常不對的。

sentences.english: This insulates you from having your custom code stomped on if you have to regenerate things.
sentences.chinese: 這種隔離不必自定義代碼踩踏如果你有再生的事情。

sentences.english: The steps have been ground away by the passing feet of many visitors over the centuries.
sentences.chinese: 這些臺階經過許多世紀遊客的踩踏，已經磨損。

sentences.english: Still remember the stampede when MJ came the year before?
sentences.chinese: 還記得傑克遜前年來的時候的踩踏事件了？

sentences.english: He advised farmers first to let sheep or cows walk on the land.
sentences.chinese: 他建議農民先讓羊或者牛進地裏踩踏。

sentences.english: The pitcher toed the mound,wound up and threw a fast ball.
sentences.chinese: 投球手用腳趾踩踏板，揮動手臂，投出了一個快球。

definition: to collide/jerking motion/to impinge/to offend/to provoke
to step on/to tread/to stamp/to press a pedal/to pedal (a bike)/(online) to downvote
to tread/to stamp/to step on/to press a pedal/to investigate on the spot
to crush sth by running over it
to step on/to tread on/to wear (shoes)/(slang) to dump (sb)/Taiwan pr. [deng4]
to fall down/to slip and fall/to throw sb to the ground
to operate by means of a pedal
